text.section: The duties and powers of a personal representative commence upon the issuance of his letters, but when done in good faith, his acts occurring prior to appointment have the same effect as those occurring after.
A personal representative may ratify and accept acts done on behalf of the estate by others if the acts would have been proper for a personal representative.
